intro: Cissampelos discolor, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that turn from green to black as they mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a popular ornamental plant in tropical gardens.
